analyzed: de'i phyir dgos pa'i khyad par rtogs pa bzhin du 'jug pa yang brjod bya bstan pa nyid kyis 'phags nas gnas pa'i phyir na nye bar mkho ba'i khyad par med do //

translated: if one is urged to do so, one would not engage in it. This is

analyzed: rims sel ba'i mtha' yas kyi rin po che nye bar ston pa la yang 'jug par thal ba'i phyir ro // dper na dgos pa med pa'i sgro 'dogs bzlog nas / dgos pa 'jug par byed pa yin pa de bzhin du sgrub par mi nus pa'i brjod bya'i blo bsal ba na /
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that the teaching of the jewel of the limitless cure for fever would also be a teaching of the purpose.

original: brjod bya yang 'jug byed yin no //
analyzed: brjod bya yang 'jug byed yin no //
translated: For example, just as the purpose is what causes one to engage in the text after the superimpositions that are the purpose of the text have been refuted, in the same way, when the thought of the expressed meaning that cannot be established is cleared away, the expressed meaning also becomes what causes one to engage in the text.

original: brjod bya yod pa dgos pa med pas ldog par yang bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: brjod bya yod pa dgos pa med pas ldog par yang bstan par mi nus te /
translated: And since the existence of the expressed meaning is not the purpose, it cannot be taught as the purpose.

original: se'u bcu la sogs pa'i ngag la ni brjod bya med pa nyid kyis dgos pa med pa yin no //üîΩbya rog gi so brtag pa nye bar dgod pa yang nye bar mkho ba yin te /
analyzed: se'u bcu la sogs pa'i ngag la ni brjod bya med pa nyid kyis dgos pa med pa yin no // bya rog gi so brtag pa nye bar dgod pa yang nye bar mkho ba yin te /
translated: For in statements such as ‚Äúten cherries‚Äù the expressed meaning is nonexistent and therefore has no purpose.

original: brjod bya'i dgos pa bsam pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod bya'i dgos pa bsam pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe crow‚Äôs tooth is to be examined‚Äù is also a statement of the purpose because it is the occasion for thinking about the purpose of the expressed meaning.

original: rjod byed kyi dgos pa de ni de'i brjod bya yod pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjod byed kyi dgos pa de ni de'i brjod bya yod pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And the purpose of the expression is not undermined by the nonexistence of the expressed meaning.

original: brjod par bya ba ni yod kyang de'i rang bzhin nges par brtags na bsgrub par mi nus pa bzhin du dgos pa med pa log par rtogs pa yang 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ni yod kyang de'i rang bzhin nges par brtags na bsgrub par mi nus pa bzhin du dgos pa med pa log par rtogs pa yang 'jug pa'am /
translated: Although there is something to be expressed, if one analyzes its nature, it cannot be established.

original: ma log na yang ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: ma log na yang ldog pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, if one does not understand the purpose, one will not engage in the text, and even if one does understand it, one will not continue to engage in it.

original: ldog pa rtogs pa de yang de'i rang bzhin rtogs na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ldog pa rtogs pa de yang de'i rang bzhin rtogs na 'gyur ro //
translated: And one will understand the purpose if one understands the nature of the text.

original: des na 'jug pa la mkho ba'i phyir dang ha cang thal ba med pa'i phyir dang spyir ma rtogs pa'i phyir ngag dang pos brjod bya nyid brjod par bya ba'i dgos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'jug pa la mkho ba'i phyir dang ha cang thal ba med pa'i phyir dang spyir ma rtogs pa'i phyir ngag dang pos brjod bya nyid brjod par bya ba'i dgos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the first statement is necessary for engagement, and since it does not lead to absurd extremes, and since it does not express the general topic, the purpose of the first statement is not to express the purpose of the expressed meaning.

original: de bas na ngag dang pos rjod byed kyi dgos pa brjod par res pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ngag dang pos rjod byed kyi dgos pa brjod par res pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the first statement is not the expression of the purpose of the expression.

original: ci ste brjod bya'i dgos pa brjod par nges pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste brjod bya'i dgos pa brjod par nges pa yin te /
translated: But if it is certain that the purpose of the first statement is to express the purpose of the expressed meaning,

original: dper na chos mchog gis /
analyzed: dper na chos mchog gis /
translated: then it would be like the Supreme Worship Sutra, which says:üîΩIf the expressed meaning were purposeless,

original: gal te brjod par bya ba yang dgos pa med pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te brjod par bya ba yang dgos pa med pa yin na ni /
translated: then the expression would be purposeless.

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa de bstan pa'i phyir sgra dgod pa'i rtsom pa yang byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa de bstan pa'i phyir sgra dgod pa'i rtsom pa yang byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And because of that, the composition of a treatise would be pointless.

original: des na brjod bya'i dgos pa nyid ngag dang pos brjod par nges so //
analyzed: des na brjod bya'i dgos pa nyid ngag dang pos brjod par nges so //
translated: Therefore, the purpose of the subject matter is definitely stated by the first sentence.

original: ngag gi dgos pa don rtogs pa dang de'i @176b yul gyi brjod bya yod cas te gzhan 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ngag gi dgos pa don rtogs pa dang de'i @176b yul gyi brjod bya yod cas te gzhan 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The purpose of the sentence is to make known the subject matter, which is the object of that purpose, and not to engage others,

original: thams cad du khyad par med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du khyad par med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that there would be no difference between any of them.

original: brjod byas khyad par can gyi 'bras bu byed na ni de'i phyir de brjod pa'i bstan bcos la 'jug pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid do zhes zer ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: brjod byas khyad par can gyi 'bras bu byed na ni de'i phyir de brjod pa'i bstan bcos la 'jug pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid do zhes zer ba lta bu'o //
translated: If it were to produce a result that is qualified by the subject matter, then it would be reasonable to engage in the treatise that expresses that.

original: gzhan ngag de yang skabs ma yin pa rjod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ngag de yang skabs ma yin pa rjod par byed pa yin te /
translated: That sentence is also irrelevant,

original: bstan bcos la 'jug par 'dod pas ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos la 'jug par 'dod pas ni /
translated: because one who wishes to engage in the treatise

original: de la gnas pa'i dgos pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i dgos pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: must state the purpose that is contained in it.

original: gzhan la dgos pa bstan pa ni gzhan la 'jug par byed par mi rigs so //
analyzed: gzhan la dgos pa bstan pa ni gzhan la 'jug par byed par mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable to engage others by teaching the purpose to others.

original: bstan bcos zhes bya ba yang khyad par gyi don ston par nus pa'i tshig la brjod kyi brjod bya tsam la ma yin zhing don ston pa'i nus pas stong pa'i tshig la yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos zhes bya ba yang khyad par gyi don ston par nus pa'i tshig la brjod kyi brjod bya tsam la ma yin zhing don ston pa'i nus pas stong pa'i tshig la yang ma yin no //
translated: A treatise is a statement that is capable of revealing a special meaning, not just a subject matter, nor a statement that is devoid of the capacity to reveal a meaning.

original: des na brjod par bya ba la brten pa'i dgos pa ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na brjod par bya ba la brten pa'i dgos pa ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the purpose of a treatise is not based on a subject matter.

original: skyes bu'i don 'grub pa thams cad ni yang dag pa'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can zhes bya ba 'dir ni /
analyzed: skyes bu'i don 'grub pa thams cad ni yang dag pa'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can zhes bya ba 'dir ni /
translated: All the aims of a person are preceded by right knowledge.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba can zhes brjod par 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba can zhes brjod par 'dod pa yin te /
translated: Here, it is intended that the right knowledge is preceded by the teaching.

original: des na dgos pa'i dgos pa brjod par bya ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: des na dgos pa'i dgos pa brjod par bya ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus, the purpose of a treatise is to reveal the purpose of the purpose.

original: de ni ma 'brel te /
analyzed: de ni ma 'brel te /
translated: This is not connected.

original: ci ltar bstan bcos la 'jug par 'dod pa la brjod bya'i dgos pa ston pa rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa de bzhin du dgos pa'i dgos pa brjod pa yang ngo //
analyzed: ci ltar bstan bcos la 'jug par 'dod pa la brjod bya'i dgos pa ston pa rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa de bzhin du dgos pa'i dgos pa brjod pa yang ngo //
translated: Just as the teaching of the subject matter is not suitable for one who wishes to enter the treatise, so too the statement of the purpose of the purpose is not suitable.

original: brjod bya tsam bzhin du bstan bcos kyi bsgrub bya dgos pa tsam yang bstan bcos ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: brjod bya tsam bzhin du bstan bcos kyi bsgrub bya dgos pa tsam yang bstan bcos ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the mere purpose of the treatise is not the treatise, just as the mere topic is not the treatise.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory for cause and effect to be the same.

original: yang gal te bstan bcos dang 'brel pa'i phyir dgos pa bstan bcos su bsnyad pa de'i tshe na brjod bya tsam de bzhin du bsnyad par mtshungs so //
analyzed: yang gal te bstan bcos dang 'brel pa'i phyir dgos pa bstan bcos su bsnyad pa de'i tshe na brjod bya tsam de bzhin du bsnyad par mtshungs so //
translated: Moreover, if the purpose is called a treatise because it is related to the treatise, then the mere topic is similar in being called that.

original: ci ltar bstan bcos dang dgos pa dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid nye bar gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ci ltar bstan bcos dang dgos pa dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid nye bar gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the nature of cause and effect of the treatise and its purpose is the reason for the designation,

original: bstan bcos dang brjod bya ngag gi brjod bya dang brjod byed kyi dngos po yang ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos dang brjod bya ngag gi brjod bya dang brjod byed kyi dngos po yang ngo //
translated: so too the treatise and the topic are the nature of the expressed and the expresser.

original: ci ste nye bar gdags pas de dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'jug pa mi 'grub kyi /
analyzed: ci ste nye bar gdags pas de dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'jug pa mi 'grub kyi /
translated: But if the purpose is not established by designation,

original: dgos pa'i dgos pa don du gnyer ba'i bstan bcos la 'jug pa ni dngos po gnas lugs nyid kyis 'grub ste /
analyzed: dgos pa'i dgos pa don du gnyer ba'i bstan bcos la 'jug pa ni dngos po gnas lugs nyid kyis 'grub ste /
translated: then engagement in the treatise that is sought by the purpose is established by the nature of things.

original: brgyud pas de dang 'brel pa'i phyir dang po'i sa bon bzhin no //
analyzed: brgyud pas de dang 'brel pa'i phyir dang po'i sa bon bzhin no //
translated: because it is related to that by way of the continuum, like the seed of the first.

original: brjod par bya ba ni bstan bcos dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir dang / de'i 'bras bu yang de dang 'brel bar ji ltar 'grub snyam na /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ni bstan bcos dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir dang / de'i 'bras bu yang de dang 'brel bar ji ltar 'grub snyam na /
translated: But since the object of expression is not related to the treatise, how can its result be established as related to that?

original: bden te / 'on kyang @177a * //
analyzed: bden te / 'on kyang @177a * //
translated: That is true, but

original: de'i bya ba don du gnyer ba de'i rgyu la 'bad pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i bya ba don du gnyer ba de'i rgyu la 'bad pa de bzhin du /
translated: just as one who seeks the activity of that strives for its cause,

original: de gsal bar byed pa'i sgron ma la yang yin no //
analyzed: de gsal bar byed pa'i sgron ma la yang yin no //
translated: so it is also for the lamp that illuminates that.

original: rgyu las yod par 'grub par shes par byed pas don du gnyer ba dag yod par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu las yod par 'grub par shes par byed pas don du gnyer ba dag yod par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because one who seeks to establish the existence of the cause strives to establish the existence of the effect.

original: ci ltar gsal bya'i don bya ba don du gnyer ba gsal byed la 'jug pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ci ltar gsal bya'i don bya ba don du gnyer ba gsal byed la 'jug pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as one who seeks the activity of the object to be illuminated engages in the illumination,

original: brjod bya'i don bya ba don du gnyer ba yang rjod byed la 'jug go / de'i phyir dngos po ni gnas pa nyid kyis rjod byed la 'jug par 'dod pa la /
analyzed: brjod bya'i don bya ba don du gnyer ba yang rjod byed la 'jug go / de'i phyir dngos po ni gnas pa nyid kyis rjod byed la 'jug par 'dod pa la /
translated: so too one who seeks the activity of the object of expression engages in the expression. Therefore, in the desire to engage the object of expression by means of the expression,

original: brjod bya'i don bya brjod pa'i phyir mtshungs so //
analyzed: brjod bya'i don bya brjod pa'i phyir mtshungs so //
translated: the activity of the object of expression is the same as the expression.

original: de ltar gal te bstan bcos las gzhan pa tsam gyi brjod bya'i don bya ba brjod pa 'gog na ;
analyzed: de ltar gal te bstan bcos las gzhan pa tsam gyi brjod bya'i don bya ba brjod pa 'gog na ;
translated: If, in that case, the statement of the purpose of the expressed meaning, which is different from the treatise, is refuted,

original: de'i tshe bstan bcos kyi bsgrub bya dgos pa'i don bya ba brjod pa yang 'gog par thal lo //
analyzed: de'i tshe bstan bcos kyi bsgrub bya dgos pa'i don bya ba brjod pa yang 'gog par thal lo //
translated: then it follows that the statement of the purpose of the probandum of the treatise is also refuted.

original: ci ste gzhan nyid yin yang khyad par yod par brjod na /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan nyid yin yang khyad par yod par brjod na /
translated: But if, although different, a distinction is made,

original: brjod bya la yang de yod pa nyid do zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: brjod bya la yang de yod pa nyid do zhes bstan zin to //
translated: then that distinction exists also in the expressed meaning, as has already been explained.

original: gzhan yang rab tu byed pa'i lus ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab tu byed pa'i lus ni gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, the body of the treatise is twofold:

original: sgra dang don to zhes bya ba de gal te tshad ma yin na de'i tshe brjod bya'i dgos pa yang bstan bcos kyi dgos pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgra dang don to zhes bya ba de gal te tshad ma yin na de'i tshe brjod bya'i dgos pa yang bstan bcos kyi dgos pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: sound and meaning. If that is a means of knowledge, then the purpose of the expressed meaning is also the purpose of the treatise,

original: de'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a part of that.

original: lag pa'i 'bras bu ni lus kyi 'bras bu ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lag pa'i 'bras bu ni lus kyi 'bras bu ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: The result of the hand is not the result of the body.

original: de ste tshad ma ma yin na /
analyzed: de ste tshad ma ma yin na /
translated: But if it is not a means of knowledge,

original: de'i tshe brjod bya tsam ni bstan bcos ma yin no zhes bya ba ma 'brel te /
analyzed: de'i tshe brjod bya tsam ni bstan bcos ma yin no zhes bya ba ma 'brel te /
translated: then it is not related to say that mere expression is not a treatise.

original: brjod bya bstan bcos nyid ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod bya bstan bcos nyid ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: But it cannot be said that the subject matter itself is not a treatise.

original: de tsam bkag na ni ji ltar mi dmigs pa tsam tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba ltar de'i khyad par ram /
analyzed: de tsam bkag na ni ji ltar mi dmigs pa tsam tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba ltar de'i khyad par ram /
translated: If you refute it to that extent, then just as non-apprehension is not a valid cognition, so too would its distinction,

original: ci ltar sa bon tsam skyed byed ma yin no zhes bya ba ltar rdzas gzhan dang lhan cig pa 'dod grang na /
analyzed: ci ltar sa bon tsam skyed byed ma yin no zhes bya ba ltar rdzas gzhan dang lhan cig pa 'dod grang na /
translated: or just as a mere seed is not a producer, so too would a substance together with another substance.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang tshig snga ma'i don 'gog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang tshig snga ma'i don 'gog pa ma yin no //
translated: But in either case, you would not be refuting the meaning of the previous statement.

original: 'dir brjod par bya ba la ni spyi dang khyad par sgo nas log par rtogs pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'dir brjod par bya ba la ni spyi dang khyad par sgo nas log par rtogs pa yang med do //
translated: Here, there is no misconception in terms of the general and specific meanings of the statement.

original: des na rdzas gzhan la ltos pa tsam lus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na rdzas gzhan la ltos pa tsam lus pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since it would remain that it is merely dependent on another substance,

original: gnyi ga bstan bcos yin par brjod par 'gyur bas ci ltar don bstan bcos yin pa bkag / des na de bkag na brjod bya bstan bcos ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di rigs pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: gnyi ga bstan bcos yin par brjod par 'gyur bas ci ltar don bstan bcos yin pa bkag / des na de bkag na brjod bya bstan bcos ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di rigs pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal lo //
translated: it would be said that both are treatises. So how could the meaning be refuted as a treatise? Thus, when that is refuted, it is logical to say that the subject matter is not a treatise. Therefore, this contradicts your own words.

original: tshig la ni kho bo cag mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: tshig la ni kho bo cag mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: We do not cling to the words.

original: gal te brjod bya bstan bcos yin pa 'gog par 'dod na de'i tshe se'u bcu la sogs pa'i ngag kyang bstan bcos su thal lo //
analyzed: gal te brjod bya bstan bcos yin pa 'gog par 'dod na de'i tshe se'u bcu la sogs pa'i ngag kyang bstan bcos su thal lo //
translated: If you want to refute the thesis that the treatise is the expressed meaning, then it follows, absurdly, that such sentences as ten pomegranates are treatises.

original: ci ste 'di la khyad par can gyi don ston par nus pa'i tshig bstan @177b bcos su brjod par bya'o zhes bshad zin to zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste 'di la khyad par can gyi don ston par nus pa'i tshig bstan @177b bcos su brjod par bya'o zhes bshad zin to zhe na /
translated: But we have already explained that the treatise is the words that have the ability to express the special meaning.

original: de ni rigs mod kyi 'on kyang phyogs 'di la gsal bya'i dpyad pa yang 'jug pas skabs 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: de ni rigs mod kyi 'on kyang phyogs 'di la gsal bya'i dpyad pa yang 'jug pas skabs 'gog par byed do //
translated: That is correct, but since the analysis of what is to be clarified is also relevant to this position, it is being refuted here.

original: gsal bya la dgos pa med na gsal byed tshol ba 'bras bu med pa'i phyir /üîΩbrjod bya'i dgos pa bstan pa bzlog tu med do //üîΩde'i phyir skyes bu'i don bsgrub pa yang brjod pa'i dgos pa yin pa la 'thad par dka' ba med do //
analyzed: gsal bya la dgos pa med na gsal byed tshol ba 'bras bu med pa'i phyir / brjod bya'i dgos pa bstan pa bzlog tu med do // de'i phyir skyes bu'i don bsgrub pa yang brjod pa'i dgos pa yin pa la 'thad par dka' ba med do //
translated: If there is no need for clarification, then it is pointless to seek clarification.üîΩTherefore, it is unavoidable that the purpose of the expressed meaning be taught.üîΩThus, the purpose of expression is also the establishment of the purpose of the person.

original: 'di ltar bstan bcos la 'jug cing de'i 'bras bu bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bstan bcos la 'jug cing de'i 'bras bu bstan pa yin la /
translated: It is not difficult to see that this is the case, for it is the result of engaging in the treatise.

original: gzhan du ni dgos pa dpyad pa'i phyir 'thad dka' bar dogs pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan du ni dgos pa dpyad pa'i phyir 'thad dka' bar dogs pa yin na /
translated: Otherwise, if it is feared that it is difficult to establish the purpose by any other means,

original: de yang bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis spangs pa yin no//
analyzed: de yang bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis spangs pa yin no//
translated: that also is avoided by the method just explained.

analyzed: yod mod kyi de'i rang bzhin gyi ni skyes bu'i don sgrub byed ma yin pa'i phyir ci ltar brjod bya'i dgos pa bstan te /

analyzed: phyi rol brjod bya ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: des na 'dra ba'i 'bras bu brjod par nges pa yin no //

analyzed: skad cig ma nyid la ni bya ba 'ga' zhig srid pa ma yin la /

analyzed: phung po gzhan med pa'i phyir sngon po nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //

original: de lta ni ma yin te /

analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa thams cad du bsal ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: des na skad cig ma'i yang don bya ba'i dbang du byas nas skad cig ma'i spyad pa la 'jug pa ma yin gyi /

original: 'on kyang spyod pa'i dgos pa la ltos nas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang spyod pa'i dgos pa la ltos nas so //

original: 'di ltar skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i nges pas bsgoms pa'i sgo nas de mngon du byed pa'i gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin /
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i nges pas bsgoms pa'i sgo nas de mngon du byed pa'i gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin /

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang 'bral ba'i 'bras bu thob par byed do //üîΩ'o na / don byed nus pa ma yin la //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang 'bral ba'i 'bras bu thob par byed do // 'o na / don byed nus pa ma yin la //
translated: It causes the attainment of the result of freedom from the suffering of cyclic existence.üîΩBut how is this to be interpreted:

original: de 'dod brtags pas ci zhig bya //
analyzed: de 'dod brtags pas ci zhig bya //
translated: If it is not able to perform a function,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin pa de ci ltar drang zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin pa de ci ltar drang zhe na /

original: bden te snang bzhin pa'i chos can gyi rang bzhin brtags pa'i dbang du byas nas de brjod de /
analyzed: bden te snang bzhin pa'i chos can gyi rang bzhin brtags pa'i dbang du byas nas de brjod de /
translated: It is true that this is stated in terms of the nature of the apparent subject that is investigated.

original: sgra'i don bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra'i don bzhin no //
translated: It is like the meaning of the word.

original: chos can yod pa nyid kyi chos kyi rang bzhin 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos can yod pa nyid kyi chos kyi rang bzhin 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: We do not accept that the nature of the property exists when the property possessor exists.

original: ci'i phyir brjod par bya dgos pa yang bstan par nges pa med do //
analyzed: ci'i phyir brjod par bya dgos pa yang bstan par nges pa med do //
translated: Nor is it certain that the purpose of the statement is taught.

original: gnyi ga'i yang ma yin te gnyi ga'i brjod bya ni gnyis po yin la /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i yang ma yin te gnyi ga'i brjod bya ni gnyis po yin la /

original: de gnyis bsal na gzhan ci zhig lus /
analyzed: de gnyis bsal na gzhan ci zhig lus /

original: 'dres pa'i gnas skabs kyang bsal zin to //
analyzed: 'dres pa'i gnas skabs kyang bsal zin to //

original: gang zhig brjod par 'gyur ba de la ni dgos pa yang cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: gang zhig brjod par 'gyur ba de la ni dgos pa yang cung zad kyang med do //
translated: And for that which is stated, there is not the slightest purpose.

original: des ni skyes bu 'jug pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: des ni skyes bu 'jug pa yang ma yin no //

original: thams cad du brjod par bya ba nyid ni bstan bcos nyan pa'i sngon rol du shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad du brjod par bya ba nyid ni bstan bcos nyan pa'i sngon rol du shes pa ma yin te /
translated: And everywhere, the mere object of statement is not known prior to hearing the treatise.

original: des na de nyid brjod par nges so //
analyzed: des na de nyid brjod par nges so //
translated: Therefore, that itself is stated.

original: gal te ma shes pa tsam gyis ni brjod pa ma yin gyi /üîΩ'on kyang 'jug pa la mkho ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te ma shes pa tsam gyis ni brjod pa ma yin gyi / 'on kyang 'jug pa la mkho ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not stated due to mere non-knowledge,üîΩthen it is not stated due to the need for engagement.

original: 'jug pa bsgrub pa ni don du gnyer ba nyid kyis yin na /
analyzed: 'jug pa bsgrub pa ni don du gnyer ba nyid kyis yin na /
translated: And the establishment of engagement is due to the need for it.

original: brjod bya ni 'ga' yang don du gnyer ba ma yin gyi ;
analyzed: brjod bya ni 'ga' yang don du gnyer ba ma yin gyi ;
translated: The subject matter is not something that anyone is interested in.

original: 'on kyang brjod bya'am rjod byed kyi dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang brjod bya'am rjod byed kyi dgos pa yin no //
translated: However, it is the purpose of the subject matter or the purpose of the expression.

original: des na ma shes pa'i brjod bya bstan pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: des na ma shes pa'i brjod bya bstan pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: So what is the point of teaching the subject matter that is not understood?

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: dgos pa brjod bya ma yin pas na dgos pa gnyis kyi rtogs pa nang du 'dus pa can gyi brjod par bya ba brjod par byas pa ni 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dgos pa brjod bya ma yin pas na dgos pa gnyis kyi rtogs pa nang du 'dus pa can gyi brjod par bya ba brjod par byas pa ni 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the purpose is not the subject matter, the subject matter that is expressed by the one who has internalized the understanding of the two purposes is engaging.

original: @179a * // 'jug pa la mkho ba med pa nyid 'dir ma grub po //
analyzed: @179a * // 'jug pa la mkho ba med pa nyid 'dir ma grub po //
translated: Therefore, the lack of need for engagement is not established here.

original: gang du brjod bya de'i dgos pa brjod pa der yang /
analyzed: gang du brjod bya de'i dgos pa brjod pa der yang /
translated: In those places where the purpose of the subject matter is stated,

original: dgos pa tsam gyis ni 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dgos pa tsam gyis ni 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: engagement is not due to the purpose alone.

original: rims nad sel ba'i mtha' yas kyi rin po che ston pa la yang thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rims nad sel ba'i mtha' yas kyi rin po che ston pa la yang thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It follows that the teaching of the jewel of the limitless medicine for the disease of the afflictions would also be engaged.

original: des na dgos pa yang thabs kyi khyad par rtogs pa dang lhan cig pa 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pas na des na brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i dgos pa gnyi ga la lhur bya ba yin no //

translated: Therefore, the purpose is the reason for engaging in the special method simultaneously with the understanding. Thus, both the purpose of the expressed and the purpose of the expression are to be taken seriously.

original: rjod pa nyid gcig la nges kyi lhur bya ba ni shugs bzhin du du ma la mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: rjod pa nyid gcig la nges kyi lhur bya ba ni shugs bzhin du du ma la mi 'gal lo //
translated: It is not contradictory for the one who takes seriously the expression itself to take seriously the many by implication.

original: lhur bya ba ni dgos pa brjod par 'dod do //
analyzed: lhur bya ba ni dgos pa brjod par 'dod do //
translated: Taking seriously is the desire to express the purpose.

original: dgos ba brjod pa'i shugs kyis de'i brjod bya 'phangs so zhes kyang rtogs par mi bya ste /
analyzed: dgos ba brjod pa'i shugs kyis de'i brjod bya 'phangs so zhes kyang rtogs par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not understand that the expressed meaning is implied by the force of the expression of the purpose.

original: skyes bu don 'grub pa'i rgyur 'dir bstan to zhes spyir brjod pas kyang rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu don 'grub pa'i rgyur 'dir bstan to zhes spyir brjod pas kyang rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is understood in general by the statement, ‚ÄúThe means of accomplishing the purpose of a person is taught here.‚Äù

original: de ltar bsgrub par mi nus pa'i dgos pa ldog pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bsgrub par mi nus pa'i dgos pa ldog pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And the purpose that cannot be accomplished in that way is not excluded.

original: de'i phyir brjod bya dang rjod byed dag gi dgos pa gnyis rtogs pa'i phyir 'jug pa la mkho bas lhur bya ba mtshungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod bya dang rjod byed dag gi dgos pa gnyis rtogs pa'i phyir 'jug pa la mkho bas lhur bya ba mtshungs so //
translated: Therefore, because engaging in the expressed and the expression is necessary for understanding both purposes, taking seriously is the same.

original: des na brjod bya 'ba' zhig nyid brjod par bya'i de'i tshe dgos pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: des na brjod bya 'ba' zhig nyid brjod par bya'i de'i tshe dgos pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the subject matter alone is to be expressed, and the purpose is not at that time.

original: des na brjod bya bstan par brjod bya ci zhig yin zhes mi rtogs pa'am /

analyzed: gzhal bya dang de kho na dag mi slu ba 'di sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma'i skyes bu'i byed pa yin no //
translated: the nondeceptive cognition of the object of valid knowledge is the activity of the person who is the valid knowledge that establishes that.

original: de'i phyir skyes bu'i don dang ldan pa'i gzhal bya bzhi ka'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bu'i don dang ldan pa'i gzhal bya bzhi ka'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Therefore, in terms of the four objects of knowledge that are meaningful for a person,

original: gzhal bya rtogs pa ni tshad ma la rag las pa yin la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhal bya rtogs pa ni tshad ma la rag las pa yin la zhes gsungs so //
translated: the realization of the object of knowledge depends on valid knowledge.

original: gang gi che yang 'ga' zhig log par rtogs pa'i yul du rgyur pa de'i tshe ni /
analyzed: gang gi che yang 'ga' zhig log par rtogs pa'i yul du rgyur pa de'i tshe ni /
translated: When the object of knowledge is the object of a mistaken cognition,

original: de yang tshad ma gzhan brtag par bya ba na /
analyzed: de yang tshad ma gzhan brtag par bya ba na /
translated: then when that is investigated by another valid knowledge,

original: gzhal bya las ma 'das pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhal bya las ma 'das pa'i phyir /
translated: since it does not go beyond the object of knowledge,

original: de rtogs pa yang tshad ma la rag las pa yin no zhes gnad du bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de rtogs pa yang tshad ma la rag las pa yin no zhes gnad du bsdus pa yin no //
translated: the realization of that also depends on valid knowledge. This is the essential point.

original: gal te tshad ma tshad mas brtag pa zhes bya ba 'di nyams pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma tshad mas brtag pa zhes bya ba 'di nyams pa ma yin nam /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt this the fallacy of infinite regress of valid knowledge?‚Äù

original: rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma la yang tshad ma gzhan gyis rtogs pa'i phyir thug pa med pas mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma la yang tshad ma gzhan gyis rtogs pa'i phyir thug pa med pas mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, with respect to the valid knowledge that realizes, it is realized by another valid knowledge, and so there is an infinite regress, and so it is not realized.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig rang nyid las tshad ma nyid du 'dod na ni dang po de lta'i dngos yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig rang nyid las tshad ma nyid du 'dod na ni dang po de lta'i dngos yin la /
translated: If someone asserts that valid knowledge is itself valid knowledge, then the first is like that.üîΩBy what cause is it thoroughly refuted?

original: rgyu gang gis na rab tu sdang // de'i phyir /üîΩtshad ma thams cad rang nyid las //
analyzed: rgyu gang gis na rab tu sdang // de'i phyir / tshad ma thams cad rang nyid las //
translated: Therefore,üîΩall valid knowledge

original: tshad ma nyid ces gzung bar gyis //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid ces gzung bar gyis //
translated: is to be taken as valid knowledge itself.

original: rang las nus pa med na ni //
analyzed: rang las nus pa med na ni //
translated: If it is powerless with respect to itself,

original: gzhan gyis bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bya bar mi nus so //
translated: it cannot be made by another.

original: zhes bya ba de yang ma 'brel te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de yang ma 'brel te /
translated: That is also incoherent.

original: log par rtogs pa'i yul ma yin yang tshad ma gzhan gyis brtags pa ma yin la /
analyzed: log par rtogs pa'i yul ma yin yang tshad ma gzhan gyis brtags pa ma yin la /
translated: Even though it is not the object of a misconception, it is not investigated by another valid knowledge.

original: tshad ma yin no cog la log par rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma yin no cog la log par rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, it is not the case that all valid knowledge is a misconception,

original: de lta yin na lkugs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir gang dang lhan cig rtsod /
analyzed: de lta yin na lkugs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir gang dang lhan cig rtsod /
translated: because if that were the case, it would follow that it is mute, and so with what would it debate?

original: kun du rtog pa'i yul gyi don du lhag par mos na ni gzhan de ltar rtogs par bsams nas ngag brjod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: kun du rtog pa'i yul gyi don du lhag par mos na ni gzhan de ltar rtogs par bsams nas ngag brjod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If one is convinced that the object of the conception is a real thing, then one utters speech thinking that the other person will understand it in the same way.

original: rang gi kun du rtog pa log par gyur na /
analyzed: rang gi kun du rtog pa log par gyur na /
translated: But if one‚Äôs conception is reversed,

original: brjod pa ci'i yan lag tu 'gyur /
analyzed: brjod pa ci'i yan lag tu 'gyur /
translated: how can it be a part of the expression?

original: tshad mar 'dod pa'i tshad ma nyid ni /
analyzed: tshad mar 'dod pa'i tshad ma nyid ni /
translated: The validity of a valid cognition

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i don nyid yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i don nyid yin no //
translated: is the nonerroneous object itself.

original: des na tshad mar @201a * //
analyzed: des na tshad mar @201a * //
translated: Therefore, one who accepts a valid cognition

original: khas len pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis tshig brjod pas thams cad du tshad ma spong ba sel bar byed do //
analyzed: khas len pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis tshig brjod pas thams cad du tshad ma spong ba sel bar byed do //
translated: removes the rejection of all valid cognitions by the utterance of words.

original: de 'dra ba gzhan 'ga' zhig tshad ma yin no zhe na 'o na tshad ma de nges par don mi nye ba dang bral ba'i tshogs pa las skye ba thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'dra ba gzhan 'ga' zhig tshad ma yin no zhe na 'o na tshad ma de nges par don mi nye ba dang bral ba'i tshogs pa las skye ba thob pa'i phyir /
translated: If someone else says that such a valid cognition is valid, then since that valid cognition is necessarily produced from a collection of causes and conditions that do not include a real thing,

original: gzhan de dang rgyu mtshungs pa can mngon sum la sogs pa yang phyin ci ma log pa'i don can gyi shes pa yin pa mi 'dod pa tsam gyis dor bar mi nus so //
analyzed: gzhan de dang rgyu mtshungs pa can mngon sum la sogs pa yang phyin ci ma log pa'i don can gyi shes pa yin pa mi 'dod pa tsam gyis dor bar mi nus so //
translated: it is impossible to reject mere nonerroneous consciousness, such as perception, which has a cause similar to that cause, simply by not asserting that it has a real thing as its object.

original: kun rdzob tu 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu 'dod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are asserted as conventional,

original: gal te tshad ma dang gzhal bya'i tha snyad ci snyed pa de thams cad kun rdzob yin no zhes rnam par gnas na /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma dang gzhal bya'i tha snyad ci snyed pa de thams cad kun rdzob yin no zhes rnam par gnas na /
translated: then if you posit that all of the conventions of valid knowledge and objects of valid knowledge are conventional,

original: de'i tshe gnod pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe gnod pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: then at that time there is no fault at all.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi tshad ma gzhan brtag par brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on te tshad ma dang gzhal bya'i gnas skabs dag tu yang /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi tshad ma gzhan brtag par brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro // 'on te tshad ma dang gzhal bya'i gnas skabs dag tu yang /
translated: This is because you wish to state that there is another valid knowledge that is the reason for that.üîΩBut if you assert that even in the context of valid knowledge and objects of valid knowledge,

original: cung zad kun rdzob tu yang 'dod na /
analyzed: cung zad kun rdzob tu yang 'dod na /
translated: some are conventional,

original: kun rdzob nyid du 'dod do zhes bya ba ci ltar ma nor /
analyzed: kun rdzob nyid du 'dod do zhes bya ba ci ltar ma nor /
translated: how could it be unmistaken to say that they are asserted as conventional?

original: kun rdzob tu yang 'dod do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang 'dod do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThey are asserted as conventional‚Äù

original: skabs dang mi 'gal te de kho na yang khas blangs par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skabs dang mi 'gal te de kho na yang khas blangs par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is not inconsistent with the context, because it teaches that even reality is accepted.

original: shes pa 'ga' zhig la ni tshad mar yang dag par rtogs /
analyzed: shes pa 'ga' zhig la ni tshad mar yang dag par rtogs /
translated: Some consciousnesses are correctly realized to be valid knowledge,

original: 'ga' la log par rtogs pa dang the tshom za'o zhes gnas pa ni /
analyzed: 'ga' la log par rtogs pa dang the tshom za'o zhes gnas pa ni /
translated: some are realized to be mistaken, and some are doubted.

original: gal te tshad ma la log par rtogs pa dang the tshom za ba'i go skabs yod pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma la log par rtogs pa dang the tshom za ba'i go skabs yod pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because there is an opportunity for valid knowledge to be mistaken or doubted,

original: des par rtogs par byed pa la yang tshad ma gzhan tshol ba srid pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: des par rtogs par byed pa la yang tshad ma gzhan tshol ba srid pa de lta na yang /
translated: it is possible that one will seek another valid knowledge in order to ascertain it.

original: yid ches pa'i skabs kyang yod pas na /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i skabs kyang yod pas na /
translated: However, there is also an opportunity for confidence.

original: mtha' snyed pas na ji ltar thug pa med par nges /
analyzed: mtha' snyed pas na ji ltar thug pa med par nges /
translated: Since there is a limit, how can there be an infinite regress?

original: de'i tshe nyid skabs med kyang dus nam yang rung bar phyis yang dag par rtogs pa 'byung ba'i skabs yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe nyid skabs med kyang dus nam yang rung bar phyis yang dag par rtogs pa 'byung ba'i skabs yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Even though there is no opportunity at that time, there will be an opportunity for the arising of correct knowledge at some later time.

original: thams cad du yang dag par rtogs pa med pa spangs pa'i phyir do //
analyzed: thams cad du yang dag par rtogs pa med pa spangs pa'i phyir do //
translated: Because it excludes the absence of correct knowledge everywhere.

original: gang du yang dag par rtogs pa'i yul tshad mar gzhan gyi go skabs mthar yang med do zhes sgrub par nus par der thug pa med par 'gyur yang thams cad du yang tshad ma gzhan gyis rtogs pa la thug pa med par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no
analyzed: gang du yang dag par rtogs pa'i yul tshad mar gzhan gyi go skabs mthar yang med do zhes sgrub par nus par der thug pa med par 'gyur yang thams cad du yang tshad ma gzhan gyis rtogs pa la thug pa med par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no
translated: If it were possible to prove that the object of correct knowledge is valid knowledge and that there is no opportunity for another to arise, then there would be an infinite regress. However, it is not the case that everywhere there is an infinite regress of valid knowledge.

original: // rang las tshad mar smra ba yang spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // rang las tshad mar smra ba yang spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the theory of self-authoritativeness would also be practiced.

original: gal te de lta na yang tshad ma tshad mas gnod po med na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang tshad ma tshad mas gnod po med na /
translated: But if the authoritative cognition is not contradicted by another authoritative cognition,

original: phan 'dogs pa yang med do zhes bya ba rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa yang med do zhes bya ba rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: is it not reasonable to say that there is no benefit?

original: 'dir rigs pa ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang 'dir tshad mar nges par gyur na de'i don du sgrub par byed pa'am gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma gzhan gyi go skabs @201b yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩgal te tshad ma'i rang bzhin yod kyang blo mi gsal bas rang bzhin gzhan sgro 'dogs par byed pa de'i tshe de'i mtshan nyid nye bar mtshon pas tshad mar tha snyad byed do zhes bya ba la mi rigs pa ci yod de lkog shal la sogs pa dang
analyzed: 'dir rigs pa ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang 'dir tshad mar nges par gyur na de'i don du sgrub par byed pa'am gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma gzhan gyi go skabs @201b yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // gal te tshad ma'i rang bzhin yod kyang blo mi gsal bas rang bzhin gzhan sgro 'dogs par byed pa de'i tshe de'i mtshan nyid nye bar mtshon pas tshad mar tha snyad byed do zhes bya ba la mi rigs pa ci yod de lkog shal la sogs pa dang
translated: Here, the reasoning is indeed true, but the meaning is that if one becomes certain about the authoritative cognition, there is no opportunity for another authoritative cognition to establish or contradict its object.

original: ldan pas ba lang nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: ldan pas ba lang nyid bzhin no //
translated: If the nature of authoritative cognition exists, but due to unclear understanding, another nature is superimposed, at that time, by indicating its characteristic, the convention of authoritative cognition is made. What is unreasonable about that? Like a cow possessing a dewlap, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma'i mtshan nyid kyang bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma'i mtshan nyid kyang bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the characteristic of authoritative cognition is also an action.

original: gzhan du rnam par phye nas tha snyad byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du rnam par phye nas tha snyad byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be untenable to make conventional distinctions.

original: 'jig rten gyi rnam pa byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi rnam pa byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the world does so,

original: 'jig rten sgras gal te bstan bcos kyi dub pa brjod na ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten sgras gal te bstan bcos kyi dub pa brjod na ni /
translated: if the word world refers to treatises,

original: de'i tshe lta ba gzhan dang gzhan dang gzhan la gnas pa'i bstan bcos byed ba rnams kyang rtsod pa yod pa'i phyir na rnam par phye ba'i gtam gang na yod /üîΩ'on te ba lang rdzi dang byis pa dang bud med la sogs pa 'jig rten du 'dod na de'i tshe de'i sgo nas rig byed dang dbang phyug la sogs pa la yang tshad ma dang cig shos su so sor nges pa'i phyir ba lang rdzi la sogs pa
analyzed: de'i tshe lta ba gzhan dang gzhan dang gzhan la gnas pa'i bstan bcos byed ba rnams kyang rtsod pa yod pa'i phyir na rnam par phye ba'i gtam gang na yod / 'on te ba lang rdzi dang byis pa dang bud med la sogs pa 'jig rten du 'dod na de'i tshe de'i sgo nas rig byed dang dbang phyug la sogs pa la yang tshad ma dang cig shos su so sor nges pa'i phyir ba lang rdzi la sogs pa
translated: then since treatises composed by those who adhere to various views are disputed, where is there a treatise that makes distinctions?

original: bas dman pa khas blangs pa la yang tshad ma cig shos nges pa'i mtshan nyid bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bas dman pa khas blangs pa la yang tshad ma cig shos nges pa'i mtshan nyid bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if you assert that the world is cowherds, children, women, and so on, then it would follow that even the inferior assertions of cowherds and so on would be defined as valid cognition, because they are ascertained as valid or invalid by the world.

original: de 'dra ba'i 'jig rten ni skad goms pa tsam la yang dbang du bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i 'jig rten ni skad goms pa tsam la yang dbang du bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Such a world is not even a valid cognition in regard to what is merely familiar.

original: dbang pos rtogs par bya ba'i don la bsgrub par bya bas rtogs pa la ni de 'dra ba'i 'jig rten yang tshad ma byed pa de tsam gyis rnam par dpyad pa chen po'i spyod yul la yang byed pa ni ma yin te /üîΩde lta ma yin na ci ltar chu dang me la sogs pa la mngon sum mam /
analyzed: dbang pos rtogs par bya ba'i don la bsgrub par bya bas rtogs pa la ni de 'dra ba'i 'jig rten yang tshad ma byed pa de tsam gyis rnam par dpyad pa chen po'i spyod yul la yang byed pa ni ma yin te / de lta ma yin na ci ltar chu dang me la sogs pa la mngon sum mam /
translated: In regard to the object to be established by the valid cognition of the senses, the world is not a valid cognition.üîΩIf it were, then how could one posit the existence of things by means of nonerroneous inference based on perception or the power of perception?

original: mngon sum gyi stobs kyis brtags pa mi 'khrul pa'i rtags las dngos po yod pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa na de 'dra ba dag gzhan la mi ltos pa de bzhin du mtho res kyi bsgrub bya la yang mi ltos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi stobs kyis brtags pa mi 'khrul pa'i rtags las dngos po yod pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa na de 'dra ba dag gzhan la mi ltos pa de bzhin du mtho res kyi bsgrub bya la yang mi ltos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Such things would not depend on anything else, just as water, fire, and so on are not dependent on anything else.üîΩIf it were not so, then how could one posit the existence of things by means of nonerroneous inference based on perception or the power of perception?

original: des na de las kyang rnam par dbye ba ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na de las kyang rnam par dbye ba ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: Thus, how could one distinguish between them?

original: ci ste bstan bcos ma goms kyang spyod pa dang / sel ba la sogs par nus par 'jig rten na /
analyzed: ci ste bstan bcos ma goms kyang spyod pa dang / sel ba la sogs par nus par 'jig rten na /
translated: But if one is not familiar with the treatises, one is not able to understand the meaning of the words.

original: 'o na de yang rigs mi mthun pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid mthong nus te /
analyzed: 'o na de yang rigs mi mthun pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid mthong nus te /
translated: Well, then, one can see the uncommon characteristics of dissimilar types.

original: bcos ma dang / cig shos kyi nor bu dang / mu tig la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bcos ma dang / cig shos kyi nor bu dang / mu tig la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, one can see that a jewel or a pearl is artificial or genuine.

original: khyad par phra mo ma rtogs na ni de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par phra mo ma rtogs na ni de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if one does not understand the subtle differences, one cannot distinguish them.

original: des na gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa rtogs pa la /
analyzed: des na gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa rtogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, in order to understand the characteristics that cannot be understood by others,

original: gsal ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu rang nyid tshad ma dang gzhan pa'i @202a * //
analyzed: gsal ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu rang nyid tshad ma dang gzhan pa'i @202a * //
translated: one must have the ability to understand the characteristics of the valid cognition that is the means of knowledge for oneself and others.

original: rnam par dbye ba byed pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid gang las rtogs pa'i blo can de dag kyang mtho ris kyi sgrub byed la sogs pa ma goms pa la yang 'jug pa dang ldog pa dag slu bar brjod par bya bar mi 'gyur ba gzhan la mi mgu
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba byed pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid gang las rtogs pa'i blo can de dag kyang mtho ris kyi sgrub byed la sogs pa ma goms pa la yang 'jug pa dang ldog pa dag slu bar brjod par bya bar mi 'gyur ba gzhan la mi mgu
translated: Those who have the intelligence to understand that characteristic will not be deceived by the engagement and disengagement of the means of establishing heaven and so on, even if they are not familiar with it.

original: ba'i bram ze mi mkhas pa la brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ba'i bram ze mi mkhas pa la brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: It is to be stated to the ignorant brahmin.

original: 'dir rang nyid kyang /üîΩde la sngon med don zhes pa //
analyzed: 'dir rang nyid kyang / de la sngon med don zhes pa //
translated: Here, you yourselfüîΩstate the definition of a non-existent object,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid byed pa na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid byed pa na /
translated: saying,

original: tshad ma rnams ni rab grags shing //
analyzed: tshad ma rnams ni rab grags shing //
translated: The valid means of knowledge are well-known,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i brjod pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i brjod pa mi rigs so //
translated: and so on.

original: 'di ni shin tu ma byang ba la rab tu grags pa rjes su brjod pa tsam yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni shin tu ma byang ba la rab tu grags pa rjes su brjod pa tsam yin no zhe na /
translated: This is mere repetition of what is well-known to the untrained.

original: gzhan gyi lan yang 'di yin par ma mthong ngam /
analyzed: gzhan gyi lan yang 'di yin par ma mthong ngam /
translated: Haven't you seen that this is also the opponent's reply?

original: dngos po rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin ni rang gi rgyu med par gzhan gang gis bya bar nus /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin ni rang gi rgyu med par gzhan gang gis bya bar nus /
translated: The nature of the characteristics of things cannot be produced by anything other than their own causes.

original: rjes su brjod pa tsam du ni 'di rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su brjod pa tsam du ni 'di rigs pa yin no //
translated: This is reasonable as mere repetition.

original: de ltar blo gros ngan pas byas pa'i zhen pas chog go //
analyzed: de ltar blo gros ngan pas byas pa'i zhen pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this fixation created by bad intellect.

original: tshad ma la yang log par rtogs pa na /
analyzed: tshad ma la yang log par rtogs pa na /
translated: When there is wrong understanding even of valid means of knowledge,

original: tshad ma gzhan gyis rtogs pas na gzhal bya'i sgra brjod do zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan gyis rtogs pas na gzhal bya'i sgra brjod do zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
translated: it is reasonable to say that the object of comprehension is stated by another valid means of knowledge.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshad mar gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das la yang log par rtogs pa'i rnam pa mang po mthong bas na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshad mar gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das la yang log par rtogs pa'i rnam pa mang po mthong bas na /
translated: Therefore, since many kinds of wrong ideas are seen in regard to the authoritative Bhagavat,

original: tshad ma gzhan gyis rtogs pa'i phyir gzhal bya nyid bsgrub par rtsom mo zhes bya ba ni gtsor bya ba'i don to //üîΩde la gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe mtho ris dang byang grol sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhal bya rtogs pa de la rag las pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan gyis rtogs pa'i phyir gzhal bya nyid bsgrub par rtsom mo zhes bya ba ni gtsor bya ba'i don to // de la gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe mtho ris dang byang grol sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhal bya rtogs pa de la rag las pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning of the statement ‚Äúone undertakes the proof of the object of knowledge by means of another authoritative means of knowledge‚Äù is the primary meaning.üîΩThe meaning is that when one accepts the Bhagavat as an authoritative means of knowledge, then one relies on the knowledge of the object of knowledge, which has the characteristic of establishing heaven and liberation.

original: gang gi tshe bsgrub par bya ba'i bcom ldan 'das gzhal bya nyid la mngon du phyogs par byed pa de'i tshe de 'dra ba'i gzhal bya rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma la rag las so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bsgrub par bya ba'i bcom ldan 'das gzhal bya nyid la mngon du phyogs par byed pa de'i tshe de 'dra ba'i gzhal bya rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma la rag las so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that when one directs oneself toward the object of knowledge, the Bhagavat, who is the probandum, then one relies on the authoritative means of knowledge that causes the knowledge of such an object of knowledge.

original: de la yang dad pa tsam gyis bcug pa rnams gus pa dang ldan yang bcom ldan 'das nges pa ni med la /
analyzed: de la yang dad pa tsam gyis bcug pa rnams gus pa dang ldan yang bcom ldan 'das nges pa ni med la /
translated: Those who are led to believe in the Buddha by mere faith, even though they are respectful, are not certain about the Bhagavat.

original: gzhan dag ni rtsod pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rtsod pa nyid do //
translated: Others are disputatious.

original: de ltar na sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma la yang gnyis so //
analyzed: de ltar na sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma la yang gnyis so //
translated: Thus, the means of valid cognition that establishes are also of two kinds.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: Otherwise,

original: de'i gzhal bya bco ma ldan 'das la yang phyin ci log dang the tshom du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i gzhal bya bco ma ldan 'das la yang phyin ci log dang the tshom du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: one would not have doubt or error with regard to the object of valid cognition, the Bhagavat.

original: tshad ma dang gzhal bya dag gi chos ni 'di nyid yin te /üîΩgcig la the tshom za ba la sogs pas gnyis pa las yul du byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma dang gzhal bya dag gi chos ni 'di nyid yin te / gcig la the tshom za ba la sogs pas gnyis pa las yul du byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is the nature of the means of valid cognition and the object of valid cognition:üîΩwhen one has doubt about one, one does not take the other as an object.

original: gcig la the tshom za ba la gzhan la nges so zhes ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: gcig la the tshom za ba la gzhan la nges so zhes ni mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that one has doubt about one and certainty about the other.

original: rnam par rtog pa @202b rnams dngos pos 'jug pas stong pa'i phyir de ltar srid kyang /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa @202b rnams dngos pos 'jug pas stong pa'i phyir de ltar srid kyang /
translated: Since conceptualization is engaged by the thing, it is possible that way, even though it is empty.

original: nges pa 'am the tshom yang rung ste /
analyzed: nges pa 'am the tshom yang rung ste /
translated: But whether it is certainty or doubt,

original: stobs dang ldan pa gcig gis gnyi ga yang gzhag par bya ba yin no zhes nges so //
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa gcig gis gnyi ga yang gzhag par bya ba yin no zhes nges so //
translated: one should definitely establish both by means of a powerful means of valid cognition.

original: des na tshad ma 'di la the tsho ma dang phyin log spong ba'i bstan bcos kyi byed pa gcig nyid ni tshang ma dang gzhal bya gnyi ga'i yang rjes su 'dzin par byed pa yin no snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: des na tshad ma 'di la the tsho ma dang phyin log spong ba'i bstan bcos kyi byed pa gcig nyid ni tshang ma dang gzhal bya gnyi ga'i yang rjes su 'dzin par byed pa yin no snyam du bsams nas /
translated: Therefore, it is thought that this valid cognition is complete with the single function of a treatise that eliminates doubt and error, and it is thought that it is that which holds both the object of valid cognition and the valid cognition itself.

original: gzhal bya rtogs pa ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhal bya rtogs pa ni zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúthe realization of the object of valid cognition.‚Äù

original: yang na gzhal bya nges pa'i don du tshad ma 'tshol ba'i phyir gzhal bya nyid 'chad par ci ste mi rtsom zhe na /
analyzed: yang na gzhal bya nges pa'i don du tshad ma 'tshol ba'i phyir gzhal bya nyid 'chad par ci ste mi rtsom zhe na /
translated: Or, why not begin the explanation with the object of valid cognition itself, since valid cognition is sought for the purpose of ascertaining the object of valid cognition?

original: gzhan la rtogs pa ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhan la rtogs pa ni zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúthe realization of another.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar chad mas ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i tshogs de ni de lta bu nyid du 'gyur dgos so //üîΩtshad mas rjes su bzung ba 'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar chad mas ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i tshogs de ni de lta bu nyid du 'gyur dgos so // tshad mas rjes su bzung ba 'am /
translated: In this way, the collection of what is to be established must necessarily be just like that.

original: tshar bcad pa'i gzhal bya ni dbang pos kyang gzhan du bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: tshar bcad pa'i gzhal bya ni dbang pos kyang gzhan du bya bar mi nus so //
translated: The object of valid cognition that is accepted by valid cognition or that is refuted by valid cognition cannot be made otherwise by the senses.

original: tshad mas re zhig yal bar dor yang slar tshad ma nyid tshol ba'i phyir na tshad ma nyid bsgrub par rigs so //
analyzed: tshad mas re zhig yal bar dor yang slar tshad ma nyid tshol ba'i phyir na tshad ma nyid bsgrub par rigs so //
translated: Even if valid cognition temporarily abandons it, since it seeks valid cognition itself again, it is reasonable to establish valid cognition itself.

original: 'o na bstan bcos gzhan bzhin du gnyi ga yang bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na bstan bcos gzhan bzhin du gnyi ga yang bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: Well, then, both would be established, like other treatises,

original: gnyi ga la yang ltos par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang ltos par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because both would be dependent.

original: gzhal bya rtogs pa ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gzhal bya rtogs pa ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe realization of the object of valid knowledge . . .‚Äù

original: bsam pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is this.

original: gzhal bya gzhan bsgrub par 'dod pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni tshad mas rjes su bzung ba nyid du gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhal bya gzhan bsgrub par 'dod pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni tshad mas rjes su bzung ba nyid du gyur ba yin no //
translated: All those who wish to establish other objects of valid knowledge are in fact already committed to valid knowledge.

original: des na tshad ma dper brjod pa nyid kyi sgo nas de bsgrub par nus kyi /
analyzed: des na tshad ma dper brjod pa nyid kyi sgo nas de bsgrub par nus kyi /
translated: Therefore, valid knowledge can be established by the mere example of valid knowledge.

original: gzhan la 'jug pa ni don med do //
analyzed: gzhan la 'jug pa ni don med do //
translated: It is pointless to engage in other [arguments].

original: dper na rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa dper brjod pa skad cig ma nyid du de'i zhar la sel ba la sogs par 'gyur ba bzhin nam /
analyzed: dper na rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa dper brjod pa skad cig ma nyid du de'i zhar la sel ba la sogs par 'gyur ba bzhin nam /
translated: For example, in the case of an inference based on nature, when the example of momentariness is stated, the absence of motion and so on are established as a byproduct.

original: mngon sum gyi yul la log par rtogs pa bsal bas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du ston pa na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi yul la log par rtogs pa bsal bas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du ston pa na /
translated: Or, when the object of direct perception is taught to be an object that possesses its own characteristics by clearing away misconceptions about its object,

original: nang dang bcas pa spyi'i phung po lnga po'i dngos po ma lus par rtogs pa nang du bsdus par bya ba bzhin te /
analyzed: nang dang bcas pa spyi'i phung po lnga po'i dngos po ma lus par rtogs pa nang du bsdus par bya ba bzhin te /
translated: The internal is included in the general five aggregates.üîΩ

original: dbang po'i shes pas gzugs kyi phung po dang / phung po gzhan ni rang rig pas dang thams cad rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pas gzugs kyi phung po dang / phung po gzhan ni rang rig pas dang thams cad rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the internal are included in the general five aggregates, because the aggregate of form is apprehended by the sense consciousnesses, the other aggregates are apprehended by reflexive awareness, and all are apprehended by the direct perception of the yogi.

original: de bzhin du gzhan du yang dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan du yang dpag par bya'o //
translated: And it should be inferred in the same way for other cases.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gzhal bya ma lus par rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dgos pa tshad ma la rag las pa de'i phyir tshad ma grub pa brjod par bya'o zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gzhal bya ma lus par rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dgos pa tshad ma la rag las pa de'i phyir tshad ma grub pa brjod par bya'o zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the purpose of valid knowledge, which is characterized by the realization of all objects of comprehension, depends on valid knowledge, therefore, one should state the establishment of valid knowledge.

original: ni'i sgra ni grags pa'i gtan tshigs ston pa'o //üîΩde ma lus @203a * //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni grags pa'i gtan tshigs ston pa'o // de ma lus @203a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúindeed‚Äù indicates a well-known reason.

original: pa'i gzhal bya rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dogs pa rab tu grags pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: pa'i gzhal bya rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dogs pa rab tu grags pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since the purpose of valid knowledge, which is characterized by the realization of all objects of comprehension, is well known,üîΩtherefore, one should state the establishment of valid knowledge.

original: tshigs su bcad pa dang po'i dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi mtshan nyid kyi brjod bya brjod pa yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa dang po'i dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi mtshan nyid kyi brjod bya brjod pa yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: The first verse states the subject matter of the treatise.

original: gzhal bya rtogs pa tshad ma la rag las pa yin mod /
analyzed: gzhal bya rtogs pa tshad ma la rag las pa yin mod /
translated: It is true that the understanding of the object depends on the valid cognition.

original: des bcom ldan 'das la cir 'gyur na /
analyzed: des bcom ldan 'das la cir 'gyur na /
translated: But what does that have to do with the Lord?

original: gang gis bcom ldan 'das bstan bcos kyi brjod bya zhes brjod pa mdzes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis bcom ldan 'das bstan bcos kyi brjod bya zhes brjod pa mdzes par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is because of that that it is proper to say that the Lord is the subject matter of the treatise.

original: des na 'dir bcom ldan 'das nyid tshad mar gyur pa sgrub pa yin no zhes ci ltar brjod ces dogs pa la /
analyzed: des na 'dir bcom ldan 'das nyid tshad mar gyur pa sgrub pa yin no zhes ci ltar brjod ces dogs pa la /
translated: So how can it be said that the Lord himself is being established as the valid cognition here?

original: tshad ma yang bcom ldan 'das nyid yin te zhes smos so ;
analyzed: tshad ma yang bcom ldan 'das nyid yin te zhes smos so ;
translated: The response is: The valid cognition is the Lord himself.

original: / gal te mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin nam /
analyzed: / gal te mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin nam /
translated: If direct perception and inference are not valid cognitions,

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid tshad ma yin par gang gis byas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid tshad ma yin par gang gis byas /
translated: what makes the Lord himself a valid cognition?

original: de la yang gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par gcod pa ni ring du spongs pa yin no zhes tshad ma'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la yang gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par gcod pa ni ring du spongs pa yin no zhes tshad ma'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: The definition of valid cognition is that it is a cognition that is non-deceptive with regard to the object that appears to it, and that which possesses that is a valid cognition.

original: 'dis ni ma 'brel pa rnam par gcod par bsal lo //
analyzed: 'dis ni ma 'brel pa rnam par gcod par bsal lo //
translated: This excludes the possibility of a non-related object.

original: gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par gcod kyang /
analyzed: gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par gcod kyang /
translated: It excludes the possibility of a related object,

original: mngon sum la sogs pa la ltos pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa la ltos pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: but it does not depend on perception and so on.

original: 'on kyang rtogs pa po'i rnam par rtog pas bzhag pa rig byed dang dbang phyug la sogs pa la ltos nas yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rtogs pa po'i rnam par rtog pas bzhag pa rig byed dang dbang phyug la sogs pa la ltos nas yin te /
translated: Rather, it depends on the conceptualization of the cognizer, such as the Vedas and ƒ™≈õvara.

original: dper na skyes bu gnyis kyi skabs su 'di nyid mkhas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha snyad ni gnyis pa la ltos pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu gnyis kyi skabs su 'di nyid mkhas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha snyad ni gnyis pa la ltos pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: For example, when two people are present, the convention ‚ÄúThis one is wise‚Äù depends on the other one.

original: gzhan thams cad mkhas pa yin pa bkag pa ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan thams cad mkhas pa yin pa bkag pa ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is not that all others are excluded as wise.

original: yang mngon sum la sogs pa la ltos nas gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par gcod pa yin mod /
analyzed: yang mngon sum la sogs pa la ltos nas gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par gcod pa yin mod /
translated: Moreover, it excludes the possibility of a related object in dependence on perception and so on.

original: phul du bya ba dang bcas pa'i tshad ma brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir skyon med de /
analyzed: phul du bya ba dang bcas pa'i tshad ma brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir skyon med de /
translated: But there is no fault because it is asserted that the best valid knowledge is stated.

original: dper na sred sgrub gzhu 'dzin no zhes bya ba'i tha snyad phul du byung ba'i gzhu 'dzin par brjod par 'dod pas yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sred sgrub gzhu 'dzin no zhes bya ba'i tha snyad phul du byung ba'i gzhu 'dzin par brjod par 'dod pas yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when one says, ‚ÄúHe is the best archer, the wielder of the bow,‚Äù one wishes to say that he is the best wielder of the bow.

original: de la gang gis ma 'brel pa rnam par gcod pa de'i tshe ni bcom ldan 'das nyid ces bya ba'i nges par gzung ba rim pa gzhan yin pas tshad ma zhes bya ba 'di'i mthar lta'o //
analyzed: de la gang gis ma 'brel pa rnam par gcod pa de'i tshe ni bcom ldan 'das nyid ces bya ba'i nges par gzung ba rim pa gzhan yin pas tshad ma zhes bya ba 'di'i mthar lta'o //
translated: When one wishes to exclude what is not the best, then the phrase ‚Äúthe Blessed One himself‚Äù is used, and the word ‚Äúvalid cognition‚Äù is placed at the end.

original: gal te 'phong gi sgyu rtsal gyi phul du byung ba dang / phul du byung ba ma yin pa ni grags pa kho na'i bcom ldan 'das kyi tshad ma'i de dag go gang gis byas she na /
analyzed: gal te 'phong gi sgyu rtsal gyi phul du byung ba dang / phul du byung ba ma yin pa ni grags pa kho na'i bcom ldan 'das kyi tshad ma'i de dag go gang gis byas she na /

original: yul gyis byas so //
analyzed: yul gyis byas so //

analyzed: skyes bu'i don mchog gi yan lag la ni bcom ldan 'das 'o na tshad ma yin gyi /

analyzed: de la gol yang don chen po nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //

original: de'i phyir tshad ma yang bcom ldan 'das nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma yang bcom ldan 'das nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavat himself is valid cognition,üîΩbecause he has the characteristics of valid cognition.

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar rigs par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar rigs par brjod pa yin no //

analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pas ni dam bcas pa thob par byed pa zhes bya ba nyid mi slu ba nyid bstan pa yin no //

original: de'i tshe ni 'di ma brjod la da lta ni brjod par zad da /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni 'di ma brjod la da lta ni brjod par zad da /
translated: At that time, it was not mentioned, but now it has been mentioned.

original: mtshan nyid kyang gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyang gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because the characteristics are also states.

original: gang gi tshe phyi'i tshul la yang gang zag bkag pa la sgo nas de kho nar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin nyid bcom ldan 'das yin par brjod pa de'i tshe tshad ma yang bcom ldan 'das nyid ces nges par bzung ba rtsod pa'i yulüîΩdu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe phyi'i tshul la yang gang zag bkag pa la sgo nas de kho nar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin nyid bcom ldan 'das yin par brjod pa de'i tshe tshad ma yang bcom ldan 'das nyid ces nges par bzung ba rtsod pa'i yul du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When, in the external mode, the nature of direct perception and inference is said to be the Bhagavat in terms of the negation of the person in reality, at that time, it is ascertained that valid cognition is the Bhagavat himself, and it does not become a subject of debate.

original: gal te de'i tshe yang rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum gyi ming can nyid dngos su bcom ldan 'das yin la /
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe yang rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum gyi ming can nyid dngos su bcom ldan 'das yin la /
translated: Even at that time, the Bhagavat himself is the one called the yogic direct perception.

original: bsgom bya'i yan lag rnam par 'jog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni de'i don gyi bcom ldan 'das su brjod de /
analyzed: bsgom bya'i yan lag rnam par 'jog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni de'i don gyi bcom ldan 'das su brjod de /

original: ston pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: ston pa nyid bzhin no //

analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i gsal ba lhag ma dag la ni bcom ldan 'das kyi tha snyad kyi dri yang med do ;
translated: The remaining instances of the terms ‚Äúdirect perception‚Äù and ‚Äúinference‚Äù are not even mentioned by the BhagavƒÅn.

analyzed: / tshad ma'i sgra ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa mtha' dag khyad par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The term ‚Äúvalid cognition‚Äù is used to distinguish all instances of direct perception and inference.

analyzed: ci ltar gang ji srid tshad ma yin pa de mtha' dag bcom ldan 'das nyid brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it that the BhagavƒÅn himself speaks of all instances of valid cognition?

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause the definition of valid cognition exists.‚Äù

original: tshad mar chos mtshungs pas na mngon sum la sogs pa'i gsal ba dag la bcom ldan 'das kyi sgra yin pa'i phyir nges par bzung ba mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: tshad mar chos mtshungs pas na mngon sum la sogs pa'i gsal ba dag la bcom ldan 'das kyi sgra yin pa'i phyir nges par bzung ba mi 'gal lo //
translated: Because of the similarity of the property of being valid cognition, the terms ‚Äúdirect perception‚Äù and so on are used to refer to the instances of valid cognition. Therefore there is no contradiction in the BhagavƒÅn‚Äôs use of the term ‚Äúvalid cognition.‚Äù
