translated: ‚ÄúEngaging‚Äù means ‚Äúfunctioning‚Äù in this context.

original: gal te 'jig rten don bya ba don du gnyer ba mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten don bya ba don du gnyer ba mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: If one sees that the world pursues the performance of objects,

original: mi slu ba'i don du gnyer ba zhes ci ste brjod /
analyzed: mi slu ba'i don du gnyer ba zhes ci ste brjod /
translated: why is it said that it pursues non-deceptive objects?

original: des na don gsal ba nyid tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na don gsal ba nyid tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the manifestation of the object itself would be valid cognition.

original: don bya ba don du gnyer ba ni bden na /
analyzed: don bya ba don du gnyer ba ni bden na /
translated: It is true that the performance of objects is pursued,

original: 'on kyang don bya ba don du gnyer ba nyid kyis na don bya ba sgrub pa la mi slu ba don du gnyer bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'on kyang don bya ba don du gnyer ba nyid kyis na don bya ba sgrub pa la mi slu ba don du gnyer bar 'gyur na /
translated: but because of pursuing the performance of objects, one pursues non-deception in accomplishing the performance of objects.

original: tshad ma nyid las 'jug par byas te /
analyzed: tshad ma nyid las 'jug par byas te /
translated: One engages in valid cognition,

original: tshad ma ma yin pa las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa las ni ma yin te /
translated: not in invalid cognition,

original: res 'ga' slu ba srid pa'i phyir ro snyam pa'i bsam pas /
analyzed: res 'ga' slu ba srid pa'i phyir ro snyam pa'i bsam pas /
translated: because deception is possible at times. With this thought in mind,

original: tshad ma tshol bar 'gyur ba yin no //üîΩdes na nges par bya ba'i yul la ltos nas dngos po'i yul can du brjod par 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma tshol bar 'gyur ba yin no // des na nges par bya ba'i yul la ltos nas dngos po'i yul can du brjod par 'dod pa yin te /
translated: It is a means of valid cognition in regard to the object to be ascertained.üîΩThus, in regard to the object to be ascertained, it is called a means of valid cognition in regard to an object, because it is said that both means of valid cognition are in regard to an object.

original: tshad ma gnyig dngos po'i yul can zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // gzung bar bya ba nyid ni dngos por nges pa ma yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: tshad ma gnyig dngos po'i yul can zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // gzung bar bya ba nyid ni dngos por nges pa ma yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: But it is not that the object to be grasped is necessarily an object.

original: gang zhig don bya ba'i don du gnyer bas 'jug pa de ni zhen par 'os pa nyid kyis na lhag par zhen pa zhes brjod de dngos po ma yin na 'jug par bslus pa nyid kyis tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig don bya ba'i don du gnyer bas 'jug pa de ni zhen par 'os pa nyid kyis na lhag par zhen pa zhes brjod de dngos po ma yin na 'jug par bslus pa nyid kyis tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: That which is engaged in for the sake of the object to be accomplished is called a special adherence because it is suitable to be adhered to. If it is not an object, it is not a means of valid cognition because it is deceptive in regard to engagement.

original: de ltar gzung bar bya ba ni dngos po nyid la mi ltos te /
analyzed: de ltar gzung bar bya ba ni dngos po nyid la mi ltos te /
translated: Thus, the object to be grasped does not depend on being an object.

original: 'jig pa dang ni nges par bya ba dang 'brel ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jig pa dang ni nges par bya ba dang 'brel ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is related to destruction and ascertainment,

original: rjes su dpag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa bzhin no //
translated: like inference.

original: de lta yin dang nya phyis mthong ba la dngul gyi bya ba la don du gnyer ba dngul nyid du zhen pa 'jug pa ni nya phyis nyid don du gnyer bas ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang nya phyis mthong ba la dngul gyi bya ba la don du gnyer ba dngul nyid du zhen pa 'jug pa ni nya phyis nyid don du gnyer bas ma yin no //
translated: If that were so, then when one sees a mother-of-pearl shell, the engagement of the desire for silver and the conception of it as silver would not be due to the desire for the mother-of-pearl shell itself.

original: gzhan snang ba na gzhan la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rang nyid 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan snang ba na gzhan la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rang nyid 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen one thing appears, another is engaged‚Äù will be explained later.

original: de'i phyir gzung ba la ltos nas don dang ldan pa tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sun phyung pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzung ba la ltos nas don dang ldan pa tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sun phyung pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the claim that a valid cognition is meaningful in dependence on an object is refuted.

original: gal te mi slu ba la mi gus par dngos po 'dzin pa tsam gyis tshad ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te mi slu ba la mi gus par dngos po 'dzin pa tsam gyis tshad ma yin na /
translated: If one is not concerned with nondeceptiveness, and a valid cognition is merely the apprehension of an entity,

original: de'i dngul gyi shes pa yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i dngul gyi shes pa yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the cognition of silver would also follow.

original: de la gal te rnam par rtog pa la dngos po ma yin pa snang ba skabs yin na /
analyzed: de la gal te rnam par rtog pa la dngos po ma yin pa snang ba skabs yin na /
translated: In that regard, if it is the case that a nonentity appears to conceptual cognition,

original: 'o na rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma yang rgyu mtshan med pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma yang rgyu mtshan med pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: then an inferential valid cognition would be without a reason.

original: des na mi slu ba nyid don du gnyer ba'i dngos po 'dzin pa ni ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: des na mi slu ba nyid don du gnyer ba'i dngos po 'dzin pa ni ma yin pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the apprehension of an entity is not concerned with nondeceptiveness.

original: rnam par rtog pa la yang dngos po 'dzin pa nyid du brjod par bya ba'i phyir dngul gyi @206a * //üîΩshes pa tshad ma yin pa yang spad bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la yang dngos po 'dzin pa nyid du brjod par bya ba'i phyir dngul gyi @206a * // shes pa tshad ma yin pa yang spad bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And because it is said that conceptual cognition apprehends an entity, the cognition of silver would be a valid cognition.

original: 'on te dngul gyi shes pa ni dngul gyi yul can nyid de /
analyzed: 'on te dngul gyi shes pa ni dngul gyi yul can nyid de /
translated: But if the cognition of silver is the cognition of silver,

original: 'on kyang yul dang dus gzhan dang 'brel pa gsal ba'i tshad ma ma yin par zad do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang yul dang dus gzhan dang 'brel pa gsal ba'i tshad ma ma yin par zad do zhe na /
translated: then it is not a valid cognition in regard to the connection with another place and time.

original: re zhig tshad ma'i sgrub byed dngos po 'dzin pa nyid yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: re zhig tshad ma'i sgrub byed dngos po 'dzin pa nyid yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is not the apprehension of an entity the proof of a valid cognition?

original: yul gzhan la sogs pa dang 'brel pa lhag par gsal bas ni de la mi gnod do //
analyzed: yul gzhan la sogs pa dang 'brel pa lhag par gsal bas ni de la mi gnod do //
translated: The connection with another place, etc., is not a special object of that [apprehension of an entity], and it is not contradicted by it.

original: de las 'jug pa'i yul gzhan la sogs pa dang 'brel pa la bslus pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de las 'jug pa'i yul gzhan la sogs pa dang 'brel pa la bslus pa'i phyir na /
translated: But it is contradicted by the connection with another place, etc., which is the object of engagement [of the apprehension of an entity].

original: don 'dzin pa yod kyang de ltar tshad ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don 'dzin pa yod kyang de ltar tshad ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Even if the apprehension of an object exists, it is not a valid cognition in that way.

original: don 'dzin pa tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don 'dzin pa tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the apprehension of an object is not the definition of a valid cognition,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would lead to an absurd consequence.

original: de la sngon med don shes pa //
analyzed: de la sngon med don shes pa //
translated: The cognition of a previously non-existent object

original: zhes bya ba yang 'di nyid kyis sun phyung ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang 'di nyid kyis sun phyung ba yin no //
translated: This is also refuted by the above.

original: gnod pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni de ma thag tu spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni de ma thag tu spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFree from error‚Äù means that it is immediately engaged.

original: gal te 'dir yang zhen par bya ba ni don nyid brjod par 'dod na de'i tshe de'i don nyid /
analyzed: gal te 'dir yang zhen par bya ba ni don nyid brjod par 'dod na de'i tshe de'i don nyid /
translated: If one wishes to state the meaning of ‚Äúnon-deceptive‚Äù here, then the meaning of that is

original: don bya ba la mi slu ba las yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don bya ba la mi slu ba las yin pa'i phyir /
translated: that it is non-deceptive with regard to the object to be engaged.

original: slu ba med pa nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: slu ba med pa nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore non-deceptiveness is valid knowledge.

original: gal te mi slu ba yang don nyid las ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi slu ba yang don nyid las ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If non-deceptiveness is not from the object itself, then what is it?

original: bden te gnyi ga yang phan tshun sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: bden te gnyi ga yang phan tshun sgrub pa yin no //
translated: It is true that both are established in mutual dependence.

original: de lta na yang gzhan gyi mtshan nyid la don smos pa ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang gzhan gyi mtshan nyid la don smos pa ni /
translated: Even so, the statement of the object in the definition of the other is

original: gzung ba 'am 'jug pa la the tshom skyed pa yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gzung ba 'am 'jug pa la the tshom skyed pa yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: because it generates doubt about the object to be apprehended or engaged.

original: bshad par dka' ba'i phyir dang / 'jug par 'dod pa rnams kyis ltos par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mi slu ba nyid tshad ma'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: bshad par dka' ba'i phyir dang / 'jug par 'dod pa rnams kyis ltos par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mi slu ba nyid tshad ma'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore non-deceptiveness is the definition of valid knowledge because it is difficult to explain, and those who wish to engage it must rely on it.

original: dngos po 'dzin pa 'am /
analyzed: dngos po 'dzin pa 'am /
translated: It is not the apprehension of an object.

original: gnod pa dang bral ba nyid ni ma yin no //üîΩde lta na gnas pa na phyir zlog pa ni /
analyzed: gnod pa dang bral ba nyid ni ma yin no // de lta na gnas pa na phyir zlog pa ni /
translated: But it is not free from faults.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //üîΩsgrub par byed pa'i shes pa rang gi ngo bos shes na /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no // sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa rang gi ngo bos shes na /
translated: Thus, in the case of endurance, the opponent‚Äôs position is as follows:üîΩIf it is said that the cognition of an object is the effect of the object,

original: mi slu ba de shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi slu ba de shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then the cognition of the object is the object itself, because the cognition of the object is the object itself.

original: brtag par bya ba ci yod ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: brtag par bya ba ci yod ces bya ba ni /
translated: What is there to investigate?

original: brtag par spong bas bstan bcos mi dgos par brjod par ro //
analyzed: brtag par spong bas bstan bcos mi dgos par brjod par ro //
translated: This means that since investigation is rejected, there is no need for a treatise.

original: de'i tshe tshad ma nyid med par 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshad ma nyid med par 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: At that time, there would be no valid cognition,

original: don gcig la 'du ba can gyi shes pas rig par bya ba nyid la sogs pa dag nyes pas zin pa'i phyir dang / rang rig pa la yang khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gcig la 'du ba can gyi shes pas rig par bya ba nyid la sogs pa dag nyes pas zin pa'i phyir dang / rang rig pa la yang khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cognition that is included in the same object, such as being known, would be defective, and because self-cognition is not accepted.

original: dran pa'i go skabs kyang med pas shes pa nyid ci yang med par 'gyur pa'i phyir bems po chen por thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa'i go skabs kyang med pas shes pa nyid ci yang med par 'gyur pa'i phyir bems po chen por thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since there would also be no opportunity for memory, cognition itself would be nothing at all, and so it would follow that everything would be a great inert mass.

original: de ltar rang gi rang bzhin rig pa med pas khas len na shes pa nyid ci @206b yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bsgrubs nas de nyid la nyes pa gzhan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar rang gi rang bzhin rig pa med pas khas len na shes pa nyid ci @206b yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bsgrubs nas de nyid la nyes pa gzhan brjod pa ni /
translated: Having established this, he states another fault in this regard:

original: phyogs 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This positionüîΩis not accepted even by the Buddhists.

original: rang gi ngo bo rig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di ni sangs rgyas pa khyed kyis bzod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di ni sangs rgyas pa khyed kyis bzod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: This position that the nature of consciousness is not aware of itself is not accepted even by the Buddhists.

original: sangs rgyas pa rnams ni rang gi ngo bo rig par smra ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa rnams ni rang gi ngo bo rig par smra ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: This is because the Buddhists maintain that consciousness is aware of itself.üîΩThe nature of consciousness is not a valid cognition

original: shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ni tshad ma ma yin te zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi brjod par bya ba nyid yin pa nyid kyis mi slu ba nyid gtsor brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ni tshad ma ma yin te zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi brjod par bya ba nyid yin pa nyid kyis mi slu ba nyid gtsor brjod pa yin no //
translated: The nature of consciousness itself is not a valid cognition. This is because the primary characteristic of a valid cognition is that it is nondeceptive.

original: gal te slu ba med pa can tshad ma ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te slu ba med pa can tshad ma ma yin nam /
translated: If it is not nondeceptive, is it not a valid cognition?

original: de rang gi ngo bo yin na tshad ma yang rang gi ngo bo nyid yin par 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa la /
analyzed: de rang gi ngo bo yin na tshad ma yang rang gi ngo bo nyid yin par 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa la /
translated: If it is its nature, then a valid cognition would be its nature.

original: mi slu ba can ni ma yin gyi zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mi slu ba can ni ma yin gyi zhes gsungs so //
translated: But it is not that it is undeceiving.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo ma yin na 'o na de ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo ma yin na 'o na de ci yin zhe na /
translated: If it is not its own nature, then what is it?

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: But, etc.

original: shes pa mi slu ba nyid du grags pa gang yin pa de ni gsal bar 'gyur ba'i don byed pa rnam par gnas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: shes pa mi slu ba nyid du grags pa gang yin pa de ni gsal bar 'gyur ba'i don byed pa rnam par gnas pa yin gyi /
translated: That which is known as the nondeceptiveness of cognition is the stability of the object that is manifested, but not its own nature.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: 'di 'chad pa ni shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di 'chad pa ni shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of this is as follows: The nature of cognition, etc.

original: 'di la 'di ltar bsam pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la 'di ltar bsam pa yin te /
translated: The idea here is as follows:

original: mi slu ba zhes bya bas mi slu ba can nyid ni mi slu ba'i sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: mi slu ba zhes bya bas mi slu ba can nyid ni mi slu ba'i sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúnondeceptive‚Äù is the reason for the application of the term ‚Äúnondeceptive‚Äù to cognition.

original: rang gi ngo bo tsam rtogs pas ni /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo tsam rtogs pas ni /
translated: But the mere apprehension of its own nature

original: mi slu ba can gyi sgra 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi slu ba can gyi sgra 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: is not the application of the term ‚Äúnondeceptive‚Äù to cognition,

original: 'di tshad ma'o snyam pa yang rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di tshad ma'o snyam pa yang rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that the thought ‚ÄúThis is valid cognition‚Äù would also be such an application.

original: de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: This is not the case,

original: des na rang gi ngo bo nyid ni mi slu ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rang gi ngo bo nyid ni mi slu ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, its own nature is not nondeceptive.

original: 'di 'dra ba 'o na ci zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba 'o na ci zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What is it like?

original: gang yod na mi slu ba'i sgra 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gang yod na mi slu ba'i sgra 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: What is it that, when it exists, the term nondeceptive is applied?üîΩThe answer is:

original: lan ni btso ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: lan ni btso ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The act of cooking, etc.üîΩis nondeceptive.

original: mi slu ba yin no'i bar ro //üîΩbyed pa grub pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: mi slu ba yin no'i bar ro // byed pa grub pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: By this,

original: las kyi chos byed pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: las kyi chos byed pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: the act of the object of action is taught.üîΩThe desire to explain the words of this verse,

original: 'di dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa dkyus la /
analyzed: 'di dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa dkyus la /
translated: etc. ,

original: 'grel bshad byed pa'i 'dod pa byed pa po'i chos yin pa bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'grel bshad byed pa'i 'dod pa byed pa po'i chos yin pa bsal ba yin no //
translated: is eliminated.üîΩAlso, it is not reasonable to assert that the act of cooking, etc.

original: gang yang btso ba la sogs pa thob par nges pa med pa'i phyir mi slu ba ni de sgrub par byed pa'i shes ba nyid yin no zhes bya bar 'dod pa de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang yang btso ba la sogs pa thob par nges pa med pa'i phyir mi slu ba ni de sgrub par byed pa'i shes ba nyid yin no zhes bya bar 'dod pa de yang mi rigs te /
translated: is nondeceptive because it is not certain that it is achieved, and that the cognition that establishes it is nondeceptive.

original: btso ba la sogs pa'i sgrub bya la bslus na sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo la yang /
analyzed: btso ba la sogs pa'i sgrub bya la bslus na sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo la yang /
translated: If the object to be established, such as cooking, is deceptive, then the nature of the cognition that establishes it is also deceptive.

original: mi slu ba gang du yod /
analyzed: mi slu ba gang du yod /
translated: Where is there any non-deception?

original: dung ba tsam la'o zhe na /
analyzed: dung ba tsam la'o zhe na /
translated: In mere interest.

original: de tsam gyis 'phangs pa'i bsgrub bya yang grub ste /üîΩyul med par ni rung ba nyid bde blag tu @207a * //
analyzed: de tsam gyis 'phangs pa'i bsgrub bya yang grub ste / yul med par ni rung ba nyid bde blag tu @207a * //
translated: The probandum that is projected by that much is also established.

original: shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For, without an object, the suitability is not easily understood.

original: gal te bsgrub bya'i blo mi brtan pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bsgrub bya'i blo mi brtan pa yod do zhe na /
translated: If there is an unstable cognition of the probandum,

original: sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin nges par rtog pa yang mi brtan pa nyid do //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin nges par rtog pa yang mi brtan pa nyid do //
translated: then the nature of the proof is also unstable.

original: rung ba'i sgras kyang sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa'i don byed pa ma nges pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rung ba'i sgras kyang sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa'i don byed pa ma nges pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúsuitability‚Äù also expresses the fact that the object of the cognition of the proof is not ascertained to be a causal process.

original: don byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyang don byed pa la mi slu ba de nyid la mi slu bar brjod par 'dod do //
analyzed: don byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyang don byed pa la mi slu ba de nyid la mi slu bar brjod par 'dod do //
translated: Those who seek causal processes also want to say that non-deception is just non-deception with respect to causal processes.

original: de ltar byas na bya ba grub pa nyid mi slu ba yin no //üîΩbrten pa zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don du smra ba la'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas na bya ba grub pa nyid mi slu ba yin no // brten pa zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don du smra ba la'o //
translated: In this way, the establishment of the causal process is itself non-deception.üîΩ‚Äú Dependence‚Äù is used for the general sense.

original: rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi 'dod pas gnyis med pa la'o //
analyzed: rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi 'dod pas gnyis med pa la'o //
translated: ‚Äú Abiding‚Äù is used for the specific sense.

original: de'i tshe ni der snang ba'i shes pa la don byed par rnam par gzhag pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni der snang ba'i shes pa la don byed par rnam par gzhag pa tsam du zad de /
translated: At that time, it is merely posited that the object performs a function for the consciousness appearing as that object.

translated: The thought is that others also do not use it conventionally.üîΩTherefore, in order to show that the second position is also the intention of others, he says, ...by another cognition.

original: sun 'byin pa ni rang gi yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

original: 'di las yin te /

analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi yul la zhugs pa de nyid kyi phyir gzhan 'gog par byed pa yin te /

analyzed: de gcig tu nges par mi rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro // de nyid kyi phyir yongs su gcod cing /

analyzed: de las gzhan rnam par gcod pa dang / phung po gsum pa med par ston par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it determines that, and from that, it excludes that which is other than it, and it shows that there is no third alternative.

original: 'on te shes pa gcig pa la phyogs pas 'jug pa na /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa gcig pa la phyogs pas 'jug pa na /

analyzed: de sgrub par byed pas de las gzhan la sgrub pa dang / dgag pa mi byed de gcig la ni 'bras bu gnyis yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so zhe na /

original: de rnam pa gcig tu nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnam pa gcig tu nges pa'i phyir ro //

original: de nyid kyi phyir gal te gzhan dgag pa byed par khas len pa la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gal te gzhan dgag pa byed par khas len pa la /

analyzed: gcig la 'bras bu gnyis yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yang rgyal po'i bka' ma yin te /

analyzed: mar me la sogs pa gcig la yang byed pa du ma mthong ba'i @210b phyir ro //
translated: because many actions are seen in a single thing, such as a butter lamp.

original: gang las rnam pa gcig tu nges pa'i phyir de mi srid par 'gyur ba dngos po med pa ni rnam pa'i khyad par yongs su 'dzin pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang las rnam pa gcig tu nges pa'i phyir de mi srid par 'gyur ba dngos po med pa ni rnam pa'i khyad par yongs su 'dzin pa ni ma yin gyi /

analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po med pa 'dzin pa ni nges pa tsam yin no //

analyzed: de ni nyams pa med pa nyid de / me mthong ba'i skom pa ni chu med par nges pa med na /

analyzed: mi 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyis byed pa gnyig dang ldan pa mthong ba'i phyir /

original: skyon ma yin no //
analyzed: skyon ma yin no //

analyzed: dogs pa 'di bsu nas mngon sum la ni tha dad pa'i 'dzin pa'i nus pa yin no snyam du zhe la bzhag ste /

analyzed: 'di la sngon po bzung ba ni sngon po ma yin pa med par nges pa ni /

analyzed: tha dad par 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin no //

analyzed: tha dad pa de yang gzung bar nus pa ma yin no //

original: 'di yang mdun du 'chad par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'o na te tha dad par ngas pa las dngos po med pa yin no zhe na /

analyzed: 'o na dngos po med pa 'dzin pa las tha dad par nges pa yin pa'i phyir phan tshun bsten par bsal lo //

analyzed: de'i phyir tshang me'i dbye ba ni rang gi yul la rag las pa yin pas /

analyzed: gzhan 'gog pa'i gtam yang med de //

analyzed: mthong ba ni mi 'thad pa med do zhes bya ba yang grub pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: me mthong ba'i de ma thag tu chu med par nges pa'i phyir 'dir chad pa med do //
translated: Because the absence of water is ascertained immediately upon seeing the fire, there is no fault here.

analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa'i skabs su mi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du dngos po med pa nges par mi nus pa des ni rmi lam gyi shes pa ni /
translated: In the context of analysis, one cannot ascertain the nonexistence of things, just as one cannot ascertain one‚Äôs own nonexistence. Therefore, the consciousness in a dream

analyzed: yul med par shes pa sad pa'i shes pas gnod pa ma yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: is not undermined by the consciousness of the waking state.üîΩThis is the position.üîΩBut is it not the case that in the world the object to be undermined and the undermining cognition are understood to exist, just as in the case of the cognition of nacre and silver?

original: gsal te nya phyis dang dngul la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du gnod bya gnod byed kyi dngos po 'jig rten na rtogs pa nyid ma yin nam bstan bcom su phyogs kyi gnod pa rnam pa bzhi bkod pa'i phyir khyod kyis kyang khas blangs pa nyid ma yin
analyzed: gsal te nya phyis dang dngul la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du gnod bya gnod byed kyi dngos po 'jig rten na rtogs pa nyid ma yin nam bstan bcom su phyogs kyi gnod pa rnam pa bzhi bkod pa'i phyir khyod kyis kyang khas blangs pa nyid ma yin
translated: And is it not the case that you also accept this, since you have presented the fourfold reasoning that undermines the opponent‚Äôs position?

original: nam snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: nam snyam du bsams nas /
translated: Thinking this,

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩ'dis ni don dam pa la ltos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // 'dis ni don dam pa la ltos te /
